LUSSEMBURGO INTERNATIONAL

ENGLISH@@@Lussemburgo final@Lussemburgo_Diesel-based privacy_final.html

ï»¿

INFORMATION NOTICE ON THE PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA PURSUANT TO ARTICLES 13 AND 14 OF EU REGULATION 679/2016 (â€œGDPRâ€)

Your privacy is extremely important to us, please read this information notice carefully.

We wish to inform you in a complete and transparent manner about the personal data processing that the companies listed in paragraph 1 below will carry out on your personal data provided by you and/or collected in the context of the contacts you will possibly have with us, including for example the following:

  • contacting our Customer Service;
  • visiting the websiteÂ www.diesel.comÂ (hereinafter the â€œSiteâ€) and/or the other websites referring to the brand, interacting with our pages on the social networks (eg. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, we chat, etc.);

 

1. WHO COLLECT YOUR PERSONAL DATA

 The companies collecting and processing personal data as autonomous data controllers (hereinafter the â€œData Controllersâ€ or the â€œCompaniesâ€) or as joint controllers are:

  • OTB S.p.A. (â€œOTBâ€), with registered office in Italy, Breganze (Vi), Via dellâ€™Industria 2, 36042, telephone +390445306555, emailÂ privacy@otb.net; OTBâ€™s Data Protection Officer (â€œDPOâ€) can be contacted atÂ dpo@otb.net;
  • Diesel S.p.A. (â€œDieselâ€), with registered office in Italy, Breganze (Vi), Via dellâ€™Industria 4-6, 36042, telephone +390424477555, emailÂ privacy@diesel.com; the Diesel Data Protection Officer (â€œDPOâ€) can be contacted atÂ dpo@otb.net;

OTB and Diesel carry out some activities as joint controllers, taking jointly the decisions regarding the purposes and means of personal data processing. Hereafter, the term â€œJoint Controllersâ€ means Diesel and OTB jointly considered when they process data as Joint Controllers.

To facilitate your understanding of the processing activities carried out by the above mentioned subjects as Controllers or Joint Controllers, we have prepared this document explaining which processing activities are carried out autonomously by each company.

Please consider that said processing activities are not intended for minors and the Data Controllers do not knowingly collect or solicit personal data from anyone under the age of 16. If you are less than 16 years old, please refrain from provide any personal data. This does not affect the applicable contract law such as the rules on the validity, formation or effect of a contract in relation to a child.

 2. WHAT PERSONAL DATA WE PROCESS

Each Company collects different categories of personal data according to the purpose for which it processes them.

Herein below we specify which categories of personal data are collected; in the following paragraph we will explain for what purposes each category of data is processed by each Data Controller or by the Joint Controllers as appropriate (hereinafter also â€œPersonal Dataâ€ if processed jointly).

  • Biographical Data: name, middle name, surname, date of birth, gender;
  • Contact Data: address of residence (street, city, province, state, zip code), domicile, email address, telephone number, mobile number;
  • Sales Data: shipping and billing address, method of delivery and payment, name of the credit card holder and expiry date of the card, information requested by the customer service, VAT number and/or tax code, passport number (the passport number will be used only for purposes related to payment where required by a law and within the limits of that law), Global Blue card number;
  • Tracking of Newsletters and Actions Data: information relating to the opening of newsletters or links;
  • Purchase Data: detail of the purchased products (eg. size, price, discount, model, collection, calculated spending level, abandoned cart, etc.);
  • Navigation Data: data relating to browsing behaviour and/or use of the websites of the Data Controllers using, for example, cookies or information relating to the pages that have been visited or searched for or related to the wishlist collected while browsing or when shopping on the online store. As for the use of cookies, please refer to the Cookie Policy available [http://diesel.com/shop/content/cookiepolicy].

 

3. FOR WHAT PURPOSES WE PROCESS YOUR PERSONAL DATA

In this paragraph we explain for what purposes each category of data is processed by each Data Controller or Joint Controller.

3.1 PURPOSES OF DIESEL S.P.A.

Diesel is the company that designs, sells and promotes the Brandâ€™s products. It is the company maintaining the contacts with you if you decide to purchase the products through the Site or other websites controlled by Diesel, if you participate in initiatives promoted by Diesel as prize competitions or other promotional initiatives; Diesel is also the company managing the loyalty program that you can sign in. Diesel will process Personal Data for the following purposes.

a) Sales activities and response to other requests made by customers

If you purchase Diesel products through the e-commerce service on the Site, Diesel will process your Biographical Data, Contact Data and Purchase Data to conclude the sale, as well as for all activities strictly connected and related to it, such as delivery or other administrative and accounting obligations.

Similarly, Diesel may need to verify the requirements for participating to special discount programs (e.g. verifying if the purchase made is a first purchase or other requirements of the regulation) and to process your Biographical Data or Contact Data to respond to any further requests that you may formulate through the Site or through the Customer Service, through telephone or chat, such as information or assistance requests.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a purchase contract to which you are a party; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel will not be able to process your request.

b) Loyalty program Registration

The Biographical Data and Contact Data will also be collected by Diesel to manage your request to join the loyalty program (D:Code). These data will be processed both to complete your membership and for all purposes strictly connected to it, instrumental or connected, including - firstly - all the activities provided for in the loyalty program. Registration could take place online through the Site by completing the application form present in electronic (tablet or other smart tool) or paper (form) format.

Furthermore, by creating an account on the Site in the reserved area, the User will become part of the Diesel Loyalty Program

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a contract for joining the loyalty program to which you are a party; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel will not be able to process your request.

c) Participation in prize contests

Diesel will be able to process your Biographical Data to allow you to participate in prize contest that Diesel could organize. In certain situations, for example to proceed with the delivery of the prize, your Contact Data could also be processed. If participation in the contest requires further information, these will be requested to you upon release of a specific privacy policy.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a contract for attending the relevant prize contest to which you are a party; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel will not be able to process your request.

d) Marketing

Only with your consent, Diesel will process the Biographical Data, Contact Data and Purchase Data for marketing purposes, that is for advertising on social networks to which you are registered or sending advertising or direct sales material, carrying out market research, commercial communication with automated contact methods (e-mail, newsletter, SMS, MMS, online messaging platforms, etc.) and traditional contact methods (mail).

Legal basis: this processing is based on the consent you have given. In the event that you are registered in the loyalty program and decide to withdraw your consent to marketing, you will continue to receive communications relating to benefits (such as the Birthday or Anniversary Gift or preview access to the new collections and promotions only reserved to members). If, in addition to the withdrawal of consent, you do not want to receive this kind of communication anymore, you will be asked to specify it. Any removal from the loyalty program will also result in the cancellation of your online account, if you have one.

You can at any time withdraw your consent to receive the above-mentioned communications by clicking on the appropriate option in each marketing email received, as well as by writing to the address privacy@diesel.com, or otherwise by contacting the Company at the addresses indicated in paragraph 1. The withdraw of consent regards only marketing emails and doesnâ€™t regard benefit emails.

3.2 PURPOSES OF THE JOINT CONTROLLERS (DIESEL AND OTB)

Diesel and OTB operate as Joint Controllers on the basis of a specific agreement for the purpose indicated below.

a) Customer profiling

With your consent, the Joint Controllers will be entitled to process Biographical Data, Contact Data, Sales Data, the Purchase Data, Tracking of Newsletters Data and Actions Data and the Navigation Data for profiling purposes and for business analysis, that is for analysis on your purchase preferences consisting of automated processing of the above mentioned Personal Data. This processing is aimed at analytically knowing or predicting your purchasing preferences also in order to create customer profiles and customize the commercial offer so that it is more in line with your preferences.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the consent you have given.

You will be entitled at any time to withdraw your consent to be subject to profiling by writing toÂ privacy@diesel.comÂ or otherwise by contacting the Joint Controllers at the addresses indicated in paragraph 1.

3.3 PURPOSES OF EACH DATA CONTROLLER OR JOINT CONTROLLER

Finally, each Data Controller or Join Controller may need to comply with a specific legal provision to which it is subject or to defend its own right in court.

a. Purposes related to the obligations established by laws or regulations, by decisions/requests of competent authorities or by supervisory and control bodies

Each Data Controller or Joint Controller may process your Personal Data to comply with a legal obligation to which it is subject.

Legal basis: compliance with a legal obligation.

The provision of data for this purpose is mandatory because in the absence of data the Data Controller or the Joint Controller will not be in a position to comply with their legal obligations.

b. Defense of rights during judicial, administrative or extra-judicial proceedings and in disputes arising in connection with the services offered

Your Personal Data may be processed by each Data Controller or Joint Controller to defend their rights or take legal action or make claims against you or third parties, including the prevention of fraud.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the legitimate interest pursued by the Data Controller or Joint Controller to protect their rights.

4. WHAT PROCESSING ACTIVITIES WE CARRY OUT WHEN YOUâ€™RE USING OUR SITE AND YOU NAVIGATE WITHOUT BEING LOGGED IN

The Site is owned by Diesel. It is possible to browse the Site without having to actively communicate your Personal Data if you are not logged in. In this case, while browsing the Site, you will remain anonymous, unless you decide to provide your data to communicate with one of the Data Controllers or with the Joint Controllers for one of the purposes described in paragraph 3.

In case of anonymous browsing, however, we inform you that the computer systems and software procedures used to operate the Site acquire, during their normal operation, some data whose transmission is implicit in the use of Internet communication protocols.

This is information that is not directly associated with identified users, but which by its very nature could, through processing and association with data held by third parties, allow these users to be identified.

This category of data includes the IP addresses or domain names of the computers used by users who connect to the Site, the addresses in URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) â€‹â€‹notation of the requested resources, information regarding access, information regarding location , the method used to submit the request to the server, the size of the file obtained in response, the numerical code indicating the status of the response given by the server (successful, error, etc.), the information regarding the userâ€™s visit including data clickstream of the URL, within and from the Site, the duration of the visit on some pages and the interaction on these pages and other parameters relating to the operating system and the userâ€™s IT environment.

These data are collected through the use of â€œcookiesâ€. We specifically use browser cookies for various purposes, including cookies strictly necessary for the operation of the Site and the use of services through the appropriate features, and the cookies that are used for personalization, performance/analysis and promotional activities. Our Cookie Policy available [http://diesel.com/shop/content/cookiepolicy] contains more information regarding the use of cookies on the Site, as well as the options for accepting or rejecting them.

The data collected while browsing the Site will be processed to (i) manage the Site and resolve any operating problems, (ii) make sure that the content of the Site is presented in the most effective way for its devices, developing, testing and making improvements to the Site, (iii) as far as possible, to keep the Site safe and secure, (iv) to obtain anonymous statistical information on the use of the Site and to check its correct functioning, (v) identify anomalies and/or abuses in the use of the Site. The data could also be used to ascertain responsibility in case of possible computer crimes committed against the Site or third parties and may be presented to the Judicial Authority, if this makes an explicit request.

5. WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DO NOT PROVIDE PERSONAL DATA

Some Personal Data that we will indicate you from time to time during the registration or purchase process are necessary for the completion of the purchase contract and for administrative and accounting purposes.

In the description of the purposes in paragraph 3, we specified when it is necessary to provide Personal Data. Where not expressly indicated as mandatory, therefore, the provision of Personal Data is optional and there will be no consequences if you do not provide them, if not the impossibility for the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers to act as described (for example, the impossibility to carry out marketing activities).

6. HOW AND HOW LONG WE WILL PROCESS PERSONAL DATA

The Personal Data provided to and/or collected by the Data Controllers or the Joint Controllers are processed and stored with automated tools and, in some cases, may be processed and stored on a paper backing. In particular, the Personal Data processed for purposes of marketing and of marketing in line with your preferences will be entered and stored in the CRM systems that allow the processing of Personal Data for these purposes.

The Personal Data will be stored for the time necessary to achieve the purposes for which they were collected. In particular, the following rules will apply:

  • data collected to enter into and perform purchase contracts, including payments: up to the conclusion of administrative and accounting obligations. The billing data will be kept for 10 years from the billing date;
  • data of the registered user for joining the loyalty program: the data will be kept as long as the account is active. Even after the termination of the account, we will retain the data if this will be necessary to comply with legal obligations, to protect our rights or to prevent fraud;
  • data related to data subjectsâ€™ requests: the data will be stored until the request is satisfied;
  • if you have provided your consent, the data processed for purposes of marketing and profiling will be stored for a period of 7 years (also according to an ad hoc provision provided for by the Italian Supervisory Authority, upon Diesel request) unless you revoke your consent. In this case, upon withdrawal of your consent, we will delate your data.

In any case, for technical reasons, the termination of the processing and the consequent cancellation or irreversible anonymization of the related Personal Data will be definitive within thirty days from the terms indicated above.

With particular reference to the judicial protection of our rights or in case of requests from the authority, the data processed will be stored for the time necessary to process the request or to protect the right.

7. WHERE PERSONAL DATA MAY BE TRANSFERRED

For the purposes indicated above, we may also transfer your Personal Data to third countries, not belonging to the European Union, which may possibly do not guarantee the same level of protection. The transfer to third countries will always take place in accordance with the provisions of the GDPR, adopting any other measures necessary to ensure the security of the Personal Data being transferred. These measures possibly include agreements incorporating the so-called â€œstandard contractual clausesâ€ issued by the European Commission or your consent. You can ask for information regarding these third countries and how to obtain a copy of the appropriate safeguards using the following email: privacy@diesel.com or writing to the postal address indicated above.

8. WHO WILL PROCESS PERSONAL DATA

Personal Data will be processed by:

  • employees and collaborators of the Data Controllers or of the Joint Controllers processing data under the authority of the Data Controllers or of the Joint Controllers;
  • employees and collaborators of the Data Processors designated by the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers, including (i) the companies managing the online store and who will be entitled to view, modify and update the Personal Data entered in the CRM systems through which the Data Controllers or the Joint Controllers carry out the processing activities for marketing and profiling purposes (ii) the companies managing the storage of the Personal Data of the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers based on agreements or local regulations;
  • third parties established in the European Union and also outside the European Union, Data Processors, used by the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers in particular for services of: Personal Data acquisition and data entry, shipping, mailing of promotional material , after sales assistance and customer service, market research, management and maintenance of the CRM systems through which the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers carry out processing activities for marketing and profiling purposes and of the other corporate information systems of the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers of the processing. The complete list of Data Processors appointed by the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers can be requested to the following email address privacy@diesel.com or writing to the postal addresses indicated above.

Personal Data may also be disclosed to third parties, independent Data Controllers, in particular to freelancers or companies providing legal or tax advice and assistance and to companies managing payments made by debit or credit cards or for fraud prevention and management activities. Furthermore, in order to be able to offer you Klarnaâ€™s payment options, we will pass to Klarna certain aspects of your personal information, such as contact and order details, in order for Klarna to assess whether you qualify for their payment options and to tailor the payment options for you. General information on Klarna you can findÂ here. Your Personal Data is handled by Klarnas as Data Controller in accordance with applicable data protection law and in accordance with the information in KlarnasÂ privacy statement.

Personal Data will not be disseminated in any way.

9. YOUR RIGHTS

Pursuant to Chapter III of the GDPR, you have the right to ask each Data Controller or Joint Controller:

  • to access to your Personal Data;
  • to receive the copy of the Personal Data you provided us (so-called â€œdata portabilityâ€) and to have data transmitted to another controller, if technically possible;
  • the rectification of the Personal Data in our possession;
  • the erasure of any Personal Data in relation to which we no longer have any legal basis for processing;
  • the limitation of the way in which we process your Personal Data, within the limits set by the applicable law data protection law.

Right to object: in addition to the rights listed above, you always have the right to object at any time to the processing of your Personal Data carried out by the Data Controller or Joint Controller for the pursuit of its legitimate interest. You have the right to object to direct marketing, which includes profiling. If you prefer that the processing of your Personal Data is carried out solely through traditional contact methods, you can object to the processing of your Personal Data carried out through automated contact methods.

You also have the right to withdraw, in whole or in part, the consent to the processing of Personal Data concerning you for the purpose of sending advertisements or direct selling or for carrying out market research or commercial communication with automated contact methods (e-mail, other remote communication systems via communication networks such as, for instance: SMS, MMS, messaging platforms, etc.) and traditional contact methods (mail).

The exercise of these rights, which can be done through the contact details indicated in paragraph 1, is not subject to formal constraints. In the event that you exercise any of the above mentioned rights, it will be the responsibility of the Data Controller or Joint Controller that you contacted to verify if you are entitled to exercise the right and to provide you with an answer, normally within a month.

As regards the Joint Controllers relationship, please note that OTB and Diesel entered into a specific agreement pursuant to article 26 of the GDPR, an extract of which is available for consultation contacting each of the Joint Data Controllers using the contact details indicated under paragraph 1.

If you believe that the processing of your Personal Data is carried out in breach of the provisions of the GDPR, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the Supervisory Authority or to start the appropriate legal actions before the competent courts.

To exercise your rights, you can send a request to the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers by writing to the addresses indicated in paragraph 1. The OTB Data Protection Officer can be contacted at the email address dpo@otb.net. The Diesel Data Protection Officer can be contacted at the email address dpo@otb.net.

LAST UPDATE FEBRUARY 2021

ENGLISH@@@Norvegia final@Norvegia_Diesel Privacy Policy _final.html

ï»¿

INFORMATION NOTICE ON THE PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA PURSUANT TO ARTICLES 13 AND 14 OF EU REGULATION 679/2016 (â€œGDPRâ€)

Your privacy is extremely important to us, please read this information notice carefully.

We wish to inform you in a complete and transparent manner about the personal data processing that the companies listed in paragraph 1 below will carry out on your personal data provided by you and/or collected in the context of the contacts you will possibly have with us, including for example the following:

  • visiting our stores
  • contacting our Customer Service;
  • visiting the websiteÂ www.diesel.comÂ (hereinafter the â€œSiteâ€) and/or the other websites referring to the brand, interacting with our pages on the social networks (eg. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, we chat, etc.);

 

1. WHO COLLECT YOUR PERSONAL DATA

 The companies collecting and processing personal data as autonomous data controllers (hereinafter the â€œData Controllersâ€ or the â€œCompaniesâ€) or as joint controllers are:

  • OTB S.p.A. (â€œOTBâ€), with registered office in Italy, Breganze (Vi), Via dellâ€™Industria 2, 36042, telephone +390445306555, emailÂ privacy@otb.net; OTBâ€™s Data Protection Officer (â€œDPOâ€) can be contacted atÂ dpo@otb.net;
  • Diesel S.p.A. (â€œDieselâ€), with registered office in Italy, Breganze (Vi), Via dellâ€™Industria 4-6, 36042, telephone +390424477555, emailÂ privacy@diesel.com; the Diesel Data Protection Officer (â€œDPOâ€) can be contacted atÂ dpo@otb.net;
  • the local affiliate of Diesel S.p.A. (â€œDiesel Affiliateâ€) of the country where you buy our products or use our services (the list of affiliates is available here).

OTB and Diesel carry out some activities as joint controllers, taking jointly the decisions regarding the purposes and means of personal data processing. Hereafter, the term â€œJoint Controllersâ€ means Diesel and OTB jointly considered when they process data as joint controllers.

To facilitate your understanding of the processing activities carried out by the above mentioned subjects as Controllers or Joint Controllers, we have prepared this document explaining which processing activities are carried out autonomously by each company.

Please consider that said processing activities are not intended for minors and the Data Controllers do not knowingly collect or solicit personal data from anyone under the age of 16. If you are less than 16 years old, please refrain from provide any personal data. This does not affect the applicable contract law such as the rules on the validity, formation or effect of a contract in relation to a child.

 2. WHAT PERSONAL DATA WE PROCESS

Each Company collects different categories of personal data according to the purpose for which it processes them.

Herein below we specify which categories of personal data are collected; in the following paragraph we will explain for what purposes each category of data is processed by each Data Controller or by the Joint Controllers as appropriate (hereinafter also â€œPersonal Dataâ€ if processed jointly).

  • Biographical Data: name, middle name, surname, date of birth, gender;
  • Contact Data: address of residence (street, city, province, state, zip code), domicile, email address, telephone number, mobile number;
  • Sales Data: shipping and billing address, method of delivery and payment, name of the credit card holder and expiry date of the card, information requested by the customer service, VAT number and/or tax code, passport number (the passport number will be used only for purposes related to payment where required by a law and within the limits of that law), Global Blue card number;
  • Tracking of Newsletters and Actions Data: information relating to the opening of newsletters or links
  • Data collected in the shop: birthday, presumed age group, in some countries the social network ID, gender, method and date of registration, store and sales assistant preferences, language, product categories of interest, methods of use services, preferences on services possibly noted in the shop, redemption campaign, events attendance, other brands purchased, products tried in the dressing room but not purchased;
  • Purchase Data: detail of the purchased products (eg. size, price, discount, model, collection, calculated spending level, abandoned cart, etc.);
  • Navigation Data: data relating to browsing behaviour and/or use of the websites of the Data Controllers using, for example, cookies or information relating to the pages that have been visited or searched for or related to the wishlist collected while browsing or when shopping on the online store. As for the use of cookies, please refer to the Cookie Policy available at the following [http://diesel.com/shop/content/cookiepolicy].

 

3. FOR WHAT PURPOSES WE PROCESS YOUR PERSONAL DATA

In this paragraph we explain for what purposes each category of data is processed by each Data Controller or Joint Controller.

3.1 PURPOSES OF DIESEL S.P.A.

Diesel is the company that designs, sells and promotes the Brandâ€™s products. It is the company maintaining the contacts with you if you decide to purchase the products through the Site or other websites controlled by Diesel or through other methods provided for by Diesel, if you participate in initiatives promoted by Diesel as prize competitions or other promotional initiatives; Diesel is also the company managing the loyalty program that you can sign in. Diesel will process Personal Data for the following purposes.

a) Sales activities and response to other requests made by customers

If you purchase Diesel products through the e-commerce service on the Site or through other methods provided for by Diesel, Diesel will process your Biographical Data, Contact Data and Purchase Data to conclude the sale, as well as for all activities strictly connected and related to it, such as delivery or other administrative and accounting obligations.

Similarly, Diesel may need to verify the requirements for participating to special discount programs (e.g. verifying if the purchase made is a first purchase or other requirements of the regulation) and to process your Biographical Data or Contact Data to respond to any further requests that you may formulate through the Site or through the Customer Service, through telephone or chat, such as information or assistance requests.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a purchase contract to which you are a party; the provision of the personal data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel will not be able to process your request.

b) Loyalty program Registration

The Biographical Data and Contact Data will also be collected by Diesel to manage your request to join the loyalty program (D:Code). These data will be processed both to complete your membership and for all purposes strictly connected to it, instrumental or connected, including - firstly - all the activities provided for in the loyalty program. Registration could take place both online through the Site, and offline in the shop, by completing the application form present in electronic (tablet or other smart tool) or paper (form) format.

Furthermore, by creating an account on the website in the reserved area, the User will become part of the Diesel Loyalty Program

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a contract for joining the loyalty program to which you are a party; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel will not be able to process your request.

c) Participation in prize contests

Diesel will be able to process your Biographical Data to allow you to participate in prize contest that Diesel could organize. In certain situations, for example to proceed with the delivery of the prize, your Contact Data could also be processed. If participation in the contest requires further information, these will be requested to you upon release of a specific privacy policy.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a contract for attending the relevant prize contest to which you are a party; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel will not be able to process your request.

d) Marketing

Only with your consent, Diesel will process the Biographical Data, Contact Data and Purchase Data for marketing purposes, that is for advertising on social networks to which you are registered or sending advertising or direct sales material, carrying out market research, commercial communication with automated contact methods (e-mail, newsletter, SMS, MMS, online messaging platforms, etc.) and traditional contact methods (mail).

Legal basis: this processing is based on the consent you have given. In the event that you are registered in the loyalty program and decide to withdraw your consent to marketing, you will continue to receive communications relating to benefits (such as the Birthday or Anniversary Gift or preview access to the new collections and promotions only reserved to members). If, in addition to the withdrawal of consent, you do not want to receive this kind of communication anymore, you will be asked to specify it. Any removal from the loyalty program will also result in the cancellation of your online account, if you have one.

You can at any time withdraw your consent to receive the above-mentioned communications by clicking on the appropriate option in each marketing email received, as well as by writing to the address privacy@diesel.com, or otherwise by contacting the company at the addresses indicated in paragraph 1. The withdraw of consent regards only marketing emails and doesnâ€™t regard benefit emails.

3.2 PURPOSES OF THE JOINT DATA CONTROLLERS (DIESEL AND OTB)

Diesel and OTB operate as joint controllers on the basis of a specific agreement for the purpose indicated below.

a) Customer profiling

With your consent, the Joint Data Controllers will be entitled to process Biographical Data, Contact Data, Sales Data, the Data collected in the shop, the Purchase Data, Tracking of Newsletters Data and Actions Data and the Navigation Data for profiling purposes and for business analysis, that is for analysis on your purchase preferences consisting of automated processing of the above mentioned personal data. This processing is aimed at analytically knowing or predicting your purchasing preferences also in order to create customer profiles and customize the commercial offer so that it is more in line with your preferences.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the consent you have given.

You will be entitled at any time to withdraw your consent to be subject to profiling by writing toÂ privacy@diesel.comÂ or otherwise by contacting the Joint Controllers at the addresses indicated in paragraph 1.

3.3 PURPOSES OF DIESEL AFFILIATE

Diesel Affiliate is the company that manages the shop where you purchased a product, possibly by phone or other methods provided for by Diesel Affiliate and to which you have requested assistance services. In some cases, it may be necessary for Diesel Affiliate to become aware of some information concerning you, to process specific requests you may have. Diesel Affiliate will process Personal Data for the following purposes.

a. Sales related services

Diesel Affiliate may need to process your Biographical Data, Contact Data and certain Sales Data (tax code and/or VAT number, passport number and Global Blue card number) to manage your purchase when concluded by phone or other methods provided for by Diesel Affiliate to manage your purchase when concluded by phone or other methods provided for by Diesel Affiliate or issue an invoice, should you request it.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a contract to which you are a party; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel Affiliate will not be able to process your request.

b. After-sales services

Diesel Affiliate may collect your Biographical Data and Contact Data to process specific requests that you may formulate in the shop, during post-sales; for example, to arrange a repair, a customization, a home delivery or to manage a return.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the performance of a contract of which you are a part; the provision of the Personal Data listed above is necessary for this purpose, since otherwise Diesel Affiliate will not be able to process your request.

3.4 PURPOSES OF ALL DATA CONTROLLERS OR JOINT CONTROLLERS

Finally, each Data Controller or Join Controller may need to comply with a specific legal provision to which it is subject or to defend its own right in court.

a. Purposes related to the obligations established by laws or regulations, by decisions/requests of competent authorities or by supervisory and control bodies

Each Data Controller or Joint Controller may process your Personal Data to comply with a legal obligation to which it is subject.

Legal basis: compliance with a legal obligation.

The provision of data for this purpose is mandatory because in the absence of data the Data Controller or the Joint Controller will not be in a position to comply with their legal obligations.

b. Defense of rights during judicial, administrative or extra-judicial proceedings and in disputes arising in connection with the services offered

Your Personal Data may be processed by each Data Controller or Joint Controller to defend their rights or take legal action or make claims against you or third parties, including the prevention of frauds.

Legal basis: this processing is based on the legitimate interest pursued by the Data Controller or Joint Controller to protect their rights.

4. WHAT PROCESSING ACTIVITIES WE CARRY OUT IF YOUâ€™RE USING OUR SITE AND YOU NAVIGATE WITHOUT BEING LOGGED IN

The Site is owned by Diesel. It is possible to browse the Site without having to actively communicate your Personal Data if you are not logged in. In this case, while browsing the Site, you will remain anonymous, unless you decide to provide your data to communicate with one of the Data Controllers or with the Joint Controllers for one of the purposes described in paragraph 3.

In case of anonymous browsing, however, we inform you that the computer systems and software procedures used to operate the Site acquire, during their normal operation, some data whose transmission is implicit in the use of Internet communication protocols.

This is information that is not directly associated with identified users, but which by its very nature could, through processing and association with data held by third parties, allow these users to be identified.

This category of data includes the IP addresses or domain names of the computers used by users who connect to the Site, the addresses in URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) â€‹â€‹notation of the requested resources, information regarding access, information regarding location , the method used to submit the request to the server, the size of the file obtained in response, the numerical code indicating the status of the response given by the server (successful, error, etc.), the information regarding the userâ€™s visit including data clickstream of the URL, within and from the Site, the duration of the visit on some pages and the interaction on these pages and other parameters relating to the operating system and the userâ€™s IT environment.

These data are collected through the use of â€œcookiesâ€. We specifically use browser cookies for various purposes, including cookies strictly necessary for the operation of the Site and the use of services through the appropriate features, and the cookies that are used for personalization, performance/analysis and promotional activities. Our Cookie Policy available [http://diesel.com/shop/content/cookiepolicy] contains more information regarding the use of cookies on the Site, as well as the options for accepting or rejecting them.

The data collected while browsing the Site will be processed to (i) manage the Site and resolve any operating problems, (ii) make sure that the content of the Site is presented in the most effective way for its devices, developing, testing and making improvements to the Site, (iii) as far as possible, to keep the Site safe and secure, (iv) to obtain anonymous statistical information on the use of the Site and to check its correct functioning, (v) identify anomalies and/or abuses in the use of the Site. The data could also be used to ascertain responsibility in case of possible computer crimes committed against the Site or third parties and may be presented to the Judicial Authority, if this makes an explicit request.

5. WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU DO NOT PROVIDE PERSONAL DATA

Some Personal Data that we will indicate you from time to time during the registration or purchase process are necessary for the completion of the purchase contract and for administrative and accounting purposes.

In the description of the purposes in paragraph 3, we specified when it is necessary to provide Personal Data. Where not expressly indicated as mandatory, therefore, the provision of Personal Data is optional and there will be no consequences if you do not provide them, if not the impossibility for the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers to act as described (for example, the impossibility to carry out marketing activities).

6. HOW AND HOW LONG WE WILL PROCESS PERSONAL DATA

The Personal Data provided to and/or collected by the Data Controllers or the Joint Controllers are processed and stored with automated tools and, in some cases, may be processed and stored on a paper backing. In particular, the Personal Data processed for purposes of marketing and of marketing in line with your preferences will be entered and stored in the CRM systems that allow the processing of Personal Data for these purposes.

The Personal Data will be stored for the time necessary to achieve the purposes for which they were collected. In particular, the following rules will apply:

  • data collected to enter into and perform purchase contracts, including payments: up to the conclusion of administrative and accounting obligations. The billing data will be kept for 10 years from the billing date;
  • data of the registered user for joining the loyalty program: the data will be kept as long as the account is active. Even after the termination of the account, we will retain the data if this will be necessary to comply with legal obligations, to protect our rights or to prevent fraud;
  • data related to data subjectsâ€™ requests: the data will be stored until the request is satisfied;
  • if you have provided your consent, the data processed for purposes of marketing and profiling will be stored for a period of 7 years (also according to an ad hoc provision provided for by the Italian Supervisory Authority upon Diesel request) unless you revoke your consent. In this case, upon withdrawal of your consent, we will delete your data.

In any case, for technical reasons, the termination of the processing and the consequent cancellation or irreversible anonymization of the related Personal Data will be definitive within thirty days from the terms indicated above.

With particular reference to the judicial protection of our rights or in case of requests from the authority, the data processed will be stored for the time necessary to process the request or to protect the right.

7. WHERE PERSONAL DATA MAY BE TRANSFERRED

For the purposes indicated above, we may also transfer your Personal Data to third countries, not belonging to the European Union / European Economic Area, which may possibly do not guarantee the same level of protection. The transfer to third countries will always take place in accordance with the provisions of the GDPR, adopting any other measures necessary to ensure the security of the personal data being transferred. These measures possibly include agreements incorporating the so-called â€œstandard contractual clausesâ€ issued by the European Commission or your consent. You can ask for information regarding these third countries and how to obtain a copy of the appropriate safeguards using the following email: privacy@diesel.com or the contact details indicated in paragraph 1.

8. WHO WILL PROCESS PERSONAL DATA

Personal Data will be processed by:

  • employees and collaborators of the Data Controllers or of the Joint Controllers processing data under the authority of the Data Controllers or of the Joint Controllers;
  • employees and collaborators of the Data Processors designated by the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers, including (i) the companies managing the shops and the online store and who will be entitled to view, modify and update the Personal Data entered in the CRM systems through which the Data Controllers or the Joint Controllers carry out the processing activities for marketing and profiling purposes (ii) the companies managing the storage of the Personal Data of the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers based on agreements or local regulations;
  • third parties established in the European Union and also outside the European Union, Data Processors, used by the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers in particular for services of: personal data acquisition and data entry, shipping, mailing of promotional material, after sales assistance and customer service, market research, management and maintenance of the CRM systems through which the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers carry out processing activities for marketing and profiling purposes and of the other corporate information systems of the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers of the processing. The complete list of Data Processors appointed by the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers can be requested to the following email address privacy@diesel.com or writing to the postal addresses indicated above.

Personal Data may also be disclosed to third parties, independent data controllers, in particular to freelancers or companies providing legal or tax advice and assistance and to companies managing payments made by debit or credit cards or for fraud prevention and management activities. Furthermore in order to be able to offer you Klarnaâ€™s payment options, we will pass to Klarna certain aspects of your personal information, such as contact and order details, in order for Klarna to assess whether you qualify for their payment options and to tailor the payment options for you. General information on Klarna you can findÂ here. Your personal data is handled by Klarnaâ€™s as Data Controller in accordance with applicable data protection law and in accordance with the information in Klarnaâ€™sÂ privacy statement.

Personal Data will not be disseminated in any way.

9. YOUR RIGHTS

Pursuant to Chapter III of the GDPR, you have the right to ask each Data Controller or Joint Controller:

  • to access to your Personal Data;
  • to receive the copy of the Personal Data you provided us (so-called â€œdata portabilityâ€) and to have data transmitted to another controller, if technically possible;
  • the rectification of the Personal Data in our possession;
  • the erasure of any Personal Data in relation to which we no longer have any legal basis for processing;
  • the limitation of the way in which we process your Personal Data, within the limits set by the applicable law data protection law.

Right to object: in addition to the rights listed above, you always have the right to object at any time to the processing of your Personal Data carried out by the Data Controller or Joint Controller for the pursuit of its legitimate interest. You have the right to object to direct marketing, which includes profiling. If you prefer that the processing of your Personal Data is carried out solely through traditional contact methods, you can object to the processing of your personal data carried out through automated contact methods.

You also have the right to withdraw, in whole or in part, the consent to the processing of Personal Data concerning you for the purpose of sending advertisements or direct selling or for carrying out market research or commercial communication with automated contact methods (e-mail, other remote communication systems via communication networks such as, for instance: SMS, MMS, messaging platforms, etc.) and traditional contact methods (mail).

The exercise of these rights, which can be done through the contact details indicated in paragraph 1, is not subject to formal constraints. In the event that you exercise any of the above mentioned rights, it will be the responsibility of the Data Controller or Joint Controller that you contacted to verify if you are entitled to exercise the right and to provide you with an answer, normally within a month.

As regards the Joint Controllers relationship, please note that OTB and Diesel entered into a specific agreement pursuant to article 26 of the GDPR, an extract of which is available for consultation contacting each of the Joint Data Controllers using the contact details indicated under paragraph 1.

If you believe that the processing of your Personal Data is carried out in breach of the provisions of the GDPR, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the Supervisory Authority or to start the appropriate legal actions before the competent courts.

The relevant Supervisory Authority in Norway is Datatilsynet. You can contact Datatilsynet in writing:

Datatilsynet

Postboks 458 Sentrum

0105 Oslo

To exercise your rights, you can send a request to the Data Controllers or Joint Controllers by writing to the addresses indicated in paragraph 1. The OTB Data Protection Officer can be contacted at the email address dpo@otb.net. The Diesel Data Protection Officer can be contacted at the email address dpo@otb.net.

INFORMASJONSMERKNAD OM BEHANDLING AV PERSONOPPLYSNINGER I HENHOLD TIL PARAGRAF 13 OG 14 I EU-FORSKRIFT 679/2016 ("GDPR")

Personvernet ditt er svÃ¦rt viktig for oss. Vennligst les denne informasjonsmerknaden nÃ¸ye.

Vi Ã¸nsker Ã¥ gi deg fullstendig og transparent informasjon om behandlingen av personopplysninger som selskapene oppgitt i avsnitt 1 nedenfor foretar med opplysningene du oppgir og/eller som innhentes gjennom kontakten du har med oss, inkludert f.eks. fÃ¸lgende:

  • besÃ¸k i butikkene vÃ¥re
  • kontakt med kundeservice
  • besÃ¸k pÃ¥ nettstedetÂ www.diesel.comÂ (heretter nettstedet") og/eller andre nettsteder knyttet til merkevaren, samhandling med sidene vÃ¥re pÃ¥ sosiale nettverk (f.eks. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, we chat osv)

 

1. HVEM INNHENTER PERSONOPPLYSNINGENE DINE?

 Selskapene som innhenter og behandler personopplysninger som selvstendige behandlingsansvarlige (heretter "behandlingsansvarlige" eller "selskaper") eller som felles behandlingsansvarlige, er:

  • OTB S.p.A. ("OTB") med registrert foretaksadresse i Italia, Breganze (Vi), Via dellâ€™Industria 2, 36042, tlf.nr. +390445306555, e-postÂ privacy@otb.net. OTBs personvernrÃ¥dgiver ("DPO") kan kontaktes viaÂ dpo@otb.net;
  • Diesel S.p.A. ("Diesel") med registrert foretaksadresse i Italia, Breganze (Vi), Via dellâ€™Industria 4-6, 36042, tlf.nr. +390424477555, e-postÂ privacy@diesel.com. Diesels personvernrÃ¥dgiver ("DPO") kan kontaktes viaÂ dpo@otb.net.
  • Det lokale datterselskapet under Diesel S.p.A. ("Diesel-datterselskap") i landet hvor du kjÃ¸per produktene eller benytter deg av tjenestene vÃ¥re (listen over datterselskaper er tilgjengelig her).

OTB og Diesel utfÃ¸rer enkelte aktiviteter som felles behandlingsansvarlige, og fatter felles beslutninger om formÃ¥lene og metodene for behandlingen av personopplysninger. Heretter betyr begrepet "felles behandlingsansvarlige" Diesel og OTB i fellesskap nÃ¥r de behandler data som felles behandlingsansvarlige.

For Ã¥ gjÃ¸re det enklere Ã¥ forstÃ¥ hvilke behandlingsaktiviteter som utfÃ¸res av de ovennevnte selskapene som behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige, har vi utarbeidet dette dokumentet, som forklarer hvilke behandlingsaktiviteter som hvert selskap utfÃ¸rer selvstendig.

VÃ¦r oppmerksom pÃ¥ at disse behandlingsaktivitetene ikke er tiltenkt mindreÃ¥rige, og at de behandlingsansvarlige ikke med overlegg innhenter eller ber om personopplysninger til personer under 16 Ã¥r. Hvis du er under 16 Ã¥r, ber vi deg avstÃ¥ fra Ã¥ oppgi personopplysninger. Dette pÃ¥virker ikke gjeldende kontraktsrett, f.eks. forskrifter om en kontrakts gyldighet, opprettelse eller effekt i forhold til et barn.

 2. PERSONOPPLYSNINGER SOM BEHANDLES

Hvert selskap innhenter ulike kategorier av personopplysninger i forhold til formÃ¥let med behandlingen.

Nedenfor spesifiserer vi hvilke kategorier av personopplysninger som innhentes. I avsnittet nedenfor forklarer vi hensikten med hver kategori av opplysninger som behandles av hver behandlingsansvarlig eller felles behandlingsansvarlig der dette er aktuelt (heretter ogsÃ¥ "personopplysninger" ved felles behandling).

  • Biografiske opplysninger: fornavn, mellomnavn, etternavn, fÃ¸dselsdato og kjÃ¸nn.
  • Kontaktopplysninger: boligadresse (gate, poststed, provins, stat, postnummer), bosted, e-postadresse, telefonnummer og mobiltelefonnummer.
  • Salgsopplysninger: leverings- og faktureringsadresse, leverings- og betalingsmÃ¥te, navn til kortinnehaver og kortets utlÃ¸psdato, informasjon forespurt av kundeservice, mva-nummer og/eller avgiftskode, passnummer (passnummeret brukes kun for formÃ¥l knyttet til betaling der loven krever det og innenfor lovens grenser) og Global Blue-kortnummer.
  • Sporing av nyhetsbrev og handlingsdata: informasjon knyttet til Ã¥pning av nyhetsbrev eller koblinger
  • Opplysninger innhentet i butikken: fÃ¸dselsdato, antatt aldersgruppe, i enkelt land sosialt-nettverk-ID, kjÃ¸nn, registreringsmetode og -dato, foretrukket butikk og salgsassistanse, sprÃ¥k, interessante produktkategorier, metoder for bruk av tjenester, foretrukne tjenester som kan vÃ¦re registrert i butikken, innlÃ¸sningskampanje, arrangementdeltakelse, kjÃ¸p av andre merkevarer og produkter prÃ¸vd i prÃ¸verom, men ikke kjÃ¸pt.
  • KjÃ¸psdata: detaljer om det kjÃ¸pte produktet (f.eks. stÃ¸rrelse, pris, rabatt, modell, kolleksjon, beregnet forbruksnivÃ¥, forkastet handlekurv osv.)
  • Navigasjonsopplysninger: data knyttet til nettlesingsadferd og/eller bruk av behandlingsansvarliges nettsteder ved hjelp av f.eks. informasjonskapsler eller informasjon knyttet til sidene som har blitt besÃ¸kt eller sÃ¸kt etter, eller knyttet til Ã¸nskelisten som innhentes under nettlesing eller kjÃ¸p i nettbutikken. Du finner mer informasjon om bruk av informasjonskapsler i Retningslinjer for informasjonskapsler ved Ã¥ klikke pÃ¥ denne koblingen [http://diesel.com/shop/content/cookiepolicy].

 

3. FORMÃ…LENE MED BEHANDLING AV PERSONOPPLYSNINGER

I dette avsnittet forklarer vi hvorfor hver behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige behandler de ulike kategoriene av opplysninger.

3.1 FORMÃ…LENE TIL DIESEL S.P.A.

Diesel er et selskap som designer, selger og promoterer merkevareprodukter. Selskapet opprettholder kontakten med deg hvis du bestemmer deg for Ã¥ kjÃ¸pe produktene gjennom nettstedet eller andre nettsteder som kontrolleres av Diesel, eller via andre metoder som Diesel har tilrettelagt, og dersom du deltar i initiativer som Diesel promoterer, f.eks. priskonkurranser eller kampanjeinitiativer. Diesel er ogsÃ¥ selskapet som administrerer fordelsprogrammet du kan delta i. Diesel behandler personopplysninger for fÃ¸lgende formÃ¥l:

a) Salgsaktiviteter og respons pÃ¥ andre forespÃ¸rsler fra kundene

Dersom du kjÃ¸per Diesel-produkter gjennom e-handeltjenesten pÃ¥ nettstedet eller via andre metoder som Diesel har tilrettelagt, behandler Diesel dine biografiske opplysninger, kontaktopplysninger og kjÃ¸psdata for Ã¥ fullfÃ¸re salget, samt alle andre aktiviteter som er direkte knyttet til det, f.eks. levering eller andre administrative eller regnskapsmessige forpliktelser.

PÃ¥ lignende mÃ¥te kan Diesel mÃ¥tte kontrollere kravene for deltakelse i spesielle rabattprogrammer (f.eks. kontroll av hvorvidt det foretatte kjÃ¸pet er det fÃ¸rste kjÃ¸pet, eller kontroll av andre andre krav iht. regelverket) og behandle dine biografiske opplysninger eller kontaktopplysninger for Ã¥ besvare andre forespÃ¸rsler du kan formulere gjennom nettstedet, kundeservice, telefon eller chat, f.eks. forespÃ¸rsler om informasjon eller assistanse.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ oppfyllelsen av en kjÃ¸pekontrakt hvor du er part. Bestemmelsene for personopplysningene ovenfor er nÃ¸dvendige for dette formÃ¥let, ettersom Diesel ellers ikke vil kunne behandle forespÃ¸rselen din.

b) PÃ¥melding til fordelsprogram

Diesel innhenter ogsÃ¥ biografiske opplysninger og kontaktopplysninger for Ã¥ administrere forespÃ¸rselen din om Ã¥ delta i fordelsprogrammet (D:Code). Disse opplysningene behandles bÃ¥de for Ã¥ fullfÃ¸re medlemskapet ditt og for alle formÃ¥l som er direkte knyttet til det, instrumentelt eller tilknyttet, inkludert fÃ¸rst og fremst alle aktivitetene som inngÃ¥r i fordelsprogrammet. Registreringen kan utfÃ¸res bÃ¥de online gjennom nettstedet og offline i butikken ved Ã¥ fylle ut sÃ¸knadsskjemaet i elektronisk format (nettbrett eller annen smartenhet) eller papirformat (skjema).

Brukeren deltar ogsÃ¥ i Diesels fordelsprogram ved Ã¥ opprette en konto pÃ¥ nettstedet i det reserverte omrÃ¥det.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ oppfyllelsen av en kontrakt for deltakelse i fordelsprogrammet hvor du er part. Den tilhÃ¸rende utleveringen av personopplysningene ovenfor er nÃ¸dvendige for dette formÃ¥let, ettersom Diesel ellers ikke vil kunne behandle forespÃ¸rselen din.

c) Deltakelse i premiekonkurranser

Diesel vil kunne behandle dine biografiske opplysninger for Ã¥ la deg delta i priskonkurranser som Diesel kan organisere. I visse situasjoner, f.eks. for Ã¥ kunne levere premier, kan kontaktopplysningene dine ogsÃ¥ behandles. Dersom deltakelse i konkurransen krever mer informasjon, blir du bedt om dette ved publisering av en spesifikk personvernerklÃ¦ring.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ oppfyllelsen av en kontrakt for deltakelse i den relevante priskonkurransen hvor du er part. Den tilhÃ¸rende utleveringen av personopplysningene ovenfor er nÃ¸dvendige for dette formÃ¥let, ettersom Diesel ellers ikke vil kunne behandle forespÃ¸rselen din.

d) MarkedsfÃ¸ring

Diesel vil, kun med ditt samtykke, behandle dine biografiske opplysninger, kontaktopplysninger og kjÃ¸psdata for markedsfÃ¸ringsformÃ¥l, dvs. annonsering pÃ¥ sosiale nettverk hvor du er registrert, eller utsending av reklame- eller direktesalgmateriale, utfÃ¸relse av markedsundersÃ¸kelser, kommersiell kommunikasjon med automatiserte kontaktmetoder (e-post, nyhetsbrev, SMS, MMS, elektroniske meldingsplattformer osv.) og tradisjonelle kontaktmetoder (brev).

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ samtykket du har gitt. Dersom du har meldt deg pÃ¥ fordelsprogrammet og bestemmer deg for Ã¥ trekke tilbake samtykket om markedsfÃ¸ring, fortsetter du Ã¥ motta kommunikasjon knyttet til fordelene (f.eks. bursdags- og jubileumsgaver eller forhÃ¥ndsvisningstilgang til nye kolleksjoner og tilbud reservert for medlemmer). Hvis du, i tillegg til tilbaketrekkingen av samtykket, ikke Ã¸nsker Ã¥ motta denne typen kommunikasjon lenger, blir du bedt om Ã¥ spesifisere dette. Fjerning fra fordelsprogrammet fÃ¸rer ogsÃ¥ til at onlinekontoen din avsluttes (dersom du har en).

Du kan til enhver tid trekke tilbake samtykket ditt om Ã¥ motta ovennevnte kommunikasjon ved Ã¥ klikke pÃ¥ det aktuelle alternativet i hver markedsfÃ¸rings-e-post som mottas, skrive til privacy@diesel.com eller kontakte selskapet pÃ¥ annen mÃ¥te via adressene oppgitt i avsnitt 1. Tilbaketrekkingen av samtykket gjelder bare markedsfÃ¸rings-e-poster, og gjelder ikke e-poster om fordeler.

3.2 FORMÃ…LET TIL DE FELLES BEHANDLINGSANSVARLIGE (DIESEL OG OTB)

Diesel og OTB opererer som felles behandlingsansvarlige pÃ¥ grunnlag av en spesifikk avtale for formÃ¥let oppgitt nedenfor.

a) Kundeprofilering

Med ditt samtykke har de felles behandlingsansvarlige rett til Ã¥ behandle biografiske opplysninger, kontaktopplysninger, salgsopplysninger, opplysninger innhentet i butikken, kjÃ¸psdata, sporing av nyhetsbrev og handlingsdata og navigasjonsopplysninger for profileringsformÃ¥l og forretningsanalyse, for Ã¥ analysere kjÃ¸pspreferansene dine gjennom automatisert behandling av ovennevnte personopplysninger. Denne behandlingen har som hensikt Ã¥ fremskaffe analytisk kunnskap eller forutsi dine dine kjÃ¸pspreferanser ogsÃ¥ for Ã¥ opprette kundeprofiler og tilpasse det kommersielle tilbudet slik at det er mer pÃ¥ linje med dine preferanser.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ samtykket du har gitt.

Du har til enhver tid rett til Ã¥ trekke tilbake samtykket om Ã¥ bli underlagt profilering ved Ã¥ skrive tilÂ privacy@diesel.comÂ eller kontakte de felles behandlingsansvarlige pÃ¥ annen mÃ¥te via adressene oppgitt i avsnitt 1.

3.3 FORMÃ…LENE TIL DIESEL-DATTERSELSKAP

Diesel-datterselskapet er selskapet som administrerer butikken hvor du kjÃ¸pte et produkt, ogsÃ¥ via telefon eller andre metoder som Diesel-datterselskapet har tilrettelagt og som du har bedt om kundestÃ¸tte. Diesel-datterselskapet kan i visse tilfeller fÃ¥ informasjon om deg for Ã¥ kunne behandle de spesifikke forespÃ¸rslene du mÃ¥tte ha. Diesel-datterselskapet behandler personopplysningene dine for fÃ¸lgende formÃ¥l:

a. Salgstjenester

Diesel-datterselskapet kan mÃ¥tte behandle dine biografiske opplysninger, kontaktopplysninger og visse salgsopplysninger (avgiftskode og/eller mva-nummer, passnummer og Global Blue-kortnummer) for Ã¥ administrere kjÃ¸pet ditt nÃ¥r det utfÃ¸res via telefon eller andre metoder som Diesel-datterselskapet har tilrettelagt eller ved utsending av en faktura, dersom du skulle be om det.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ oppfyllelsen av en kontrakt hvor du er part. Bestemmelsene for personopplysningene ovenfor er nÃ¸dvendige for dette formÃ¥let, ettersom Diesel-datterselskapet ellers ikke vil kunne behandle forespÃ¸rselen din.

b. Ettersalgstjenester

Diesel-datterselskap kan innhente dine biografiske opplysninger og kontaktopplysninger for Ã¥ behandle spesifikke forespÃ¸rsler som du kan formulere i butikken under ettersalg, f.eks. for Ã¥ avtale reparasjon, tilpasning, levering hjem eller administrere retur.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ oppfyllelsen av en kontrakt hvor du er part. Den tilhÃ¸rende utleveringen av personopplysningene ovenfor er nÃ¸dvendige for dette formÃ¥let, ettersom Diesel-datterselskapet ellers ikke vil kunne behandle forespÃ¸rselen din.

3.4 FORMÃ…LENE TIL ALLE BEHANDLINGSANSVARLIGE ELLER FELLES BEHANDLINGSANSVARLIGE

Hver behandlingsansvarlig eller felles behandlingsansvarlig kan ogsÃ¥ mÃ¥tte overholde spesifikke lovbestemmelse som vedkommende er underlagt, eller forsvare sine egne rettigheter i retten.

a. FormÃ¥l knyttet til forpliktelser fastsatt av lover eller forskrifter etter beslutning/forespÃ¸rsel fra kompetente myndigheter eller tilsyns- og kontrollorgan

Hver behandlingsansvarlig eller felles behandlingsansvarlig kan behandle personopplysningene dine for Ã¥ overholde juridiske forpliktelser som vedkommende er underlagt.

Juridisk grunnlag: Overholdelse av en juridisk forpliktelse.

Fremskaffelsen av opplysninger for dette formÃ¥let er obligatorisk, fordi de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige ikke kan overholde sine juridiske forpliktelser dersom opplysningene mangler.

b. Forsvar av rettigheter under juridisk, administrativ eller utenomrettslige saksbehandlinger og i tvister i forbindelse med tilbudte tjenester

Hver behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige kan behandle personopplysningene dine for Ã¥ forsvare rettighetene sine, reise sak eller reise krav mot deg eller tredjeparter, inkludert forebygging av svindel.

Juridisk grunnlag: Denne behandlingen er basert pÃ¥ behandlingsansvarliges eller felles behandlingsansvarliges legitime interesse i Ã¥ beskytte sine egne rettigheter.

4. BEHANDLINGSAKTIVITETER SOM UTFÃ˜RES HVIS DU BRUKER NETTSTEDET OG NAVIGERER UTEN Ã… VÃ†RE INNLOGGET

Nettstedet eies av Diesel. Det er mulig Ã¥ besÃ¸ke nettstedet uten Ã¥ kommunisere personopplysningene dine aktivt hvis du ikke er innlogget. I sÃ¥ fall forblir du anonym mens du besÃ¸ker nettstedet, med mindre du bestemmer deg for Ã¥ oppgi opplysningene dine for Ã¥ kommunisere med en av de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige i forbindelse med et av formÃ¥lene beskrevet i avsnitt 3.

VÃ¦r oppmerksom pÃ¥ at ved anonym nettlesing krever datamaskinsystemene og programvareprosedyrene, som benyttes for Ã¥ operere nettstedet, visse opplysninger under normal drift. OverfÃ¸ringen av disse dataene er implisitt i bruken av internett-kommunikasjonsprotokoller.

Dette er informasjon som ikke er direkte knyttet til identifiserte brukere, men som pÃ¥ grunn av sin natur kan identifisere brukerne dersom dataene behandles og knyttes til data fra tredjeparter.

Denne kategorien av opplysninger inkluderer IP-adressene eller domenenavnene til datamaskinene som benyttes av brukere som kobler seg til nettstedet, adresser i URI (Uniform Resource Identifier)-notasjoner fra de forespurte ressursene, informasjon om tilgang, informasjon om lokalitet, metoden brukt for Ã¥ sende forespÃ¸rsler til serveren, stÃ¸rrelsen pÃ¥ filen som anskaffes i svar, den numeriske koden som indikerer statusen til svaret fra serveren (vellykket, feil osv.), informasjon om brukerens besÃ¸k, inkludert URL-ens klikkstrÃ¸mdata innenfor og fra nettstedet, besÃ¸kets varighet pÃ¥ enkelte sider og samhandlingen med disse sidene, samt andre parametere knyttet til operativsystemet og brukerens IT-miljÃ¸.

Disse opplysningene innhentes gjennom bruk av "informasjonskapsler". Vi bruker informasjonskapsler spesifikt for ulike formÃ¥l, inkludert informasjonskapsler som er helt nÃ¸dvendige for at nettstedet skal fungere og bruken av hensiktsmessige funksjoner, samt informasjonskapsler som brukes for individuell tilpasning, ytelse/analyse og salgsfremmende aktiviteter. VÃ¥re Retningslinjer for informasjonskapsler [http://diesel.com/shop/content/cookiepolicy] inneholder mer informasjon om bruken av informasjonskapsler pÃ¥ nettstedet, samt alternativene for Ã¥ godta eller avvise dem.

Opplysningene som innhentes under lesing av nettstedet, behandles for Ã¥ (i) administrere nettstedet og lÃ¸se eventuelle driftproblemer, (ii) sikre at innholdet pÃ¥ nettstedet presenteres sÃ¥ effektivt som mulig for dets enheter samt utvikle, teste og forbedre nettstedet, (iii) holde nettstedet sikkert og trygt i den grad det er mulig, (iv) skaffe anonym statistisk informasjon om bruken av nettstedet og kontrollere at det fungerer korrekt, (v) identifisere avvik og/eller misbruk av nettstedet. Opplysningene kan ogsÃ¥ benyttes for Ã¥ fastslÃ¥ ansvar i tilfelle av eventuell datakriminalitet mot nettstedet eller tredjeparter, og gis til juridiske myndigheter dersom de ber om dette eksplisitt.

5. DETTE SKJER HVIS DU IKKE OPPGIR PERSONOPPLYSNINGER

Enkelte personopplysninger som vi indikerer fra tid til annen under registrering eller kjÃ¸psprosessen, er nÃ¸dvendige for Ã¥ fullfÃ¸re kjÃ¸pekontrakten og for administrative og regnskapsmessige formÃ¥l.

I beskrivelsen av formÃ¥lene i avsnitt 3 spesifiserte vi nÃ¥r det er nÃ¸dvendig Ã¥ oppgi personopplysninger. Der det ikke er uttrykkelig beskrevet som obligatorisk, er det altsÃ¥ frivillig Ã¥ oppgi personopplysninger. Det blir ingen konsekvenser dersom du ikke oppgir dem, bortsett fra at det blir umulig for behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige Ã¥ handle som beskrevet (f.eks. umulig Ã¥ utfÃ¸re markedsfÃ¸ringsaktiviteter).

6. HVORDAN OG HVOR LENGE PERSONOPPLYSNINGENE BEHANDLES

Personopplysningene som gis til og/eller innhentes av behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige, behandles og lagres med automatiserte verktÃ¸y, og kan i noen tilfeller behandles og lagres som papirkopier. SÃ¦rlig kan personopplysninger som behandles for markedsfÃ¸ringsformÃ¥l og markedsfÃ¸ring i samsvar med preferansene dine, legges inn og lagres i CRM-systemer som gjÃ¸r det mulig Ã¥ behandle personopplysninger for disse formÃ¥lene.

Personopplysningene lagres sÃ¥ lenge det er nÃ¸dvendig for Ã¥ oppfylle formÃ¥lene som de ble innhentet for. SÃ¦rlig gjelder fÃ¸lgende regler:

  • Opplysninger innhentet for Ã¥ inngÃ¥ og oppfylle kjÃ¸pekontrakter, inkludert betalinger: frem til avslutningen av administrative og regnskapsmessige forpliktelser. Faktureringsopplysninger oppbevares i 10 Ã¥r fra faktureringsdatoen.
  • Opplysninger om den registrerte brukeren for Ã¥ delta i fordelsprogrammet: Opplysningene oppbevares sÃ¥ lenge kontoen er aktiv. Vi beholder opplysningene selv etter avslutning av kontoen dersom dette er nÃ¸dvendig for Ã¥ overholde juridiske forpliktelser, beskytte vÃ¥re rettigheter eller forebygge svindel.
  • Opplysninger knyttet til forespÃ¸rsler fra registrerte personer: Opplysningene lagres til forespÃ¸rselen er fullfÃ¸rt.
  • Hvis du samtykker, vil opplysningene som behandles for markedsfÃ¸rings- og profileringsformÃ¥l lagres i 7 Ã¥r (ogsÃ¥ i samsvar med en ad hoc-forskrift fra italienske tilsynsmyndighet etter forespÃ¸rsel fra Diesel) med mindre du trekker tilbake samtykket. I sÃ¥ fall sletter vi opplysningene dine nÃ¥r du trekker tilbake samtykket.

Under alle omstendigheter vil avslutningen av behandlingen, samt den etterfÃ¸lgende slettingen eller ugjenkallelige anonymiseringen av de tilknyttede personopplysningene, av tekniske Ã¥rsaker vÃ¦re endelig innen tretti dager fra periodene oppgitt ovenfor.

SÃ¦rlig med hensyn til juridisk beskyttelse av rettighetene dine, eller ved forespÃ¸rsler fra myndighetene, vil opplysningene som behandles, lagres sÃ¥ lenge det er nÃ¸dvendig for Ã¥ behandle forespÃ¸rselen eller beskytte rettigheten.

7. HVOR KAN PERSONOPPLYSNINGENE OVERFÃ˜RES?

For formÃ¥lene oppgitt ovenfor kan vi ogsÃ¥ overfÃ¸re personopplysningene dine til tredje land som ikke tilhÃ¸rer EU/EÃ˜S-omrÃ¥det, og som kanskje ikke garanterer det samme beskyttelsesnivÃ¥et. OverfÃ¸ringen til tredje land skjer alltid i samsvar med forskriftene i GDPR, og iverksetter alle andre nÃ¸dvendige tiltak for Ã¥ ivareta sikkerheten til personopplysningene som overfÃ¸res. Disse tiltakene kan inkludere avtaler som inkorporerer sÃ¥kalte "standard kontraktsklausuler" utstedt av EU-kommisjonen eller med ditt samtykke. Du kan be om informasjon om disse tredje landene og hvordan du fÃ¥r en kopi av de hensiktsmessige forholdsreglene via fÃ¸lgende e-postadresse: privacy@diesel.com. Du kan ogsÃ¥ benytte kontaktinformasjonen oppgitt i avsnitt 1.

8. HVEM BEHANDLER PERSONOPPLYSNINGENE?

Personopplysningene behandles av:

  • De behandlingsansvarliges eller felles behandlingsansvarliges ansatte og medarbeidere som behandler opplysningene med fullmakt fra behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige.
  • De ansatte og medarbeiderne til databehandlerne som er utpekt av de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige, inkluderer (i) selskapene som administrerer butikkene og nettbutikkene og som har rett til Ã¥ gjennomgÃ¥, endre og oppdatere personopplysningene som legges inn i CRM-systemene som de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige benytter for Ã¥ utfÃ¸re behandlingsaktivitetene for markedsfÃ¸rings- og profileringsformÃ¥l (ii) selskapene som administrerer lagringen av personopplysningene til de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige basert pÃ¥ avtaler eller lokale forskrifter.
  • Tredjeparter etablert i eller utenfor EU, databehandlere som de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige sÃ¦rlig benytter for tjenester innen: innhenting av personopplysninger og dataregistrering, forsendelse av reklamemateriale, ettersalgsassistanse og kundeservice, markedsundersÃ¸kelser, administrasjon og vedlikehold av CRM-systemene som de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige benytter for Ã¥ utfÃ¸re behandlingsaktivitetene for markedsfÃ¸rings- og profileringsformÃ¥l, samt av andre bedriftsinformasjonssystemer som de behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige benytter til behandlingen. Den fullstendige listen over databehandlere som er utpekt av behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige, kan forespÃ¸rres via e-postadressen privacy@diesel.com eller ved Ã¥ skrive til postadressene oppgitt ovenfor.

Personopplysninger kan ogsÃ¥ videreformidles til tredje, uavhengige behandlingsansvarlige parter, sÃ¦rlig frilansere eller selskaper som yter juridisk bistand eller skatterÃ¥dgivning, selskaper som administrerer betalinger via debetkort eller kredittkort eller for administrasjonsaktiviteter og forebygging av svindel. For Ã¥ kunne tilby deg Klarnas betalingsalternativer, vil vi ogsÃ¥ videresende visse deler av personopplysningene dine til Klarna, som kontaktopplysninger og ordredetaljer, slik at Klarna kan vurdere hvorvidt du kan godkjennes for bruk av betalingsalternativer deres og hvorvidt betalingsalternativene kan tilpasses til deg. Du finner generell informasjon om KlarnaÂ her. Personopplysningene dine hÃ¥ndteres av Klarna som behandlingsansvarlig i samsvar med gjeldende personvernlovgivning og i samsvar med informasjonen i KlarnasÂ personvernerklÃ¦ring.

Personopplysningene dine blir ikke spredt pÃ¥ noen mÃ¥te.

9. DINE RETTIGHETER

I henhold til kapittel III i GDPR har du rett til Ã¥ be hver behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige om:

  • tilgang til personopplysningene dine
  • Ã¥ motta en kopi av personopplysningene du har gitt oss (sÃ¥kalt "dataportabilitet") og fÃ¥ opplysningene overfÃ¸rt til en annen behandlingsansvarlig dersom det er teknisk mulig
  • oppretting av personopplysninger i vÃ¥r besittelse
  • sletting av alle personopplysninger som vi ikke lenger har juridisk grunnlag for Ã¥ behandle
  • begrensning av hvordan vi behandler personopplysningene dine innenfor grensene fastsatt av gjeldende personvernlovgivning

Retten til Ã¥ motsette seg behandling: I tillegg til rettighetene ovenfor har du alltid rett til Ã¥ til enhver tid motsette deg behandlingen av personopplysningene som utfÃ¸res av behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige for deres legitime interesser. Du har rett til Ã¥ motsette deg direkte markedsfÃ¸ring, som inkluderer profilering. Hvis du foretrekker at behandlingen av personopplysningene dine kun utfÃ¸res gjennom tradisjonelle kontaktmetoder, kan du motsette deg at behandlingen av personopplysningene dine utfÃ¸res gjennom automatiserte kontaktmetoder.

Du har ogsÃ¥ rett til Ã¥ trekke tilbake, helt eller delvis, samtykket om behandling av personopplysninger om deg for formÃ¥lene reklameutsending, direktesalg, utfÃ¸relse av markedsundersÃ¸kelser eller kommersiell kommunikasjon med automatiserte kontaktmetoder (e-post, andre eksterne kommunikasjonssystemer via kommunikasjonsnettverk, f.eks.: SMS, MMS, meldingsplattformer osv.) og tradisjonelle kontaktmetoder (brev).

UtÃ¸velsen av disse rettighetene, som kan skje gjennom kontaktinformasjonen oppgitt i avsnitt 1, er ikke underlagt formelle restriksjoner. Dersom du utÃ¸ver en av de ovennevnte rettighetene, er det ansvaret til den behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige som du kontaktet, Ã¥ kontrollere at du har rett til Ã¥ utÃ¸ve rettigheten og gi deg svar, vanligvis innen Ã©n mÃ¥ned.

NÃ¥r det gjelder partnerskapet mellom de felles behandlingsansvarlige, gjÃ¸r vi deg oppmerksom pÃ¥ at OTB og Diesel inngikk en spesifikk avtale i henhold til artikkel 26 i GDPR. Et utdrag av denne artikkelen er tilgjengelig ved Ã¥ kontakte en av de felles behandlingsansvarlige ved hjelp av kontaktinformasjonen oppgitt i avsnitt 1.

Dersom du mener at behandlingen av personopplysningene dine ikke utfÃ¸res i samsvar med forskriftene i GDPR, har du rett til Ã¥ fremme en klage til tilsynsmyndighetene eller foreta nÃ¸dvendige rettslige skritt hos kompetent domstol.

Relevant tilsynsmyndighet i Norge er Datatilsynet. Du kan kontakte Datatilsynet skriftlig:

Datatilsynet

Postboks 458 Sentrum

0105 Oslo

For Ã¥ utÃ¸ve rettighetene dine kan du sende en forespÃ¸rsel til behandlingsansvarlige eller felles behandlingsansvarlige via adressene oppgitt i avsnitt 1. OTBs personvernrÃ¥dgiver kan kontaktes via e-postadressen dpo@otb.net. Diesels personvernrÃ¥dgiver kan kontaktes via e-postadressen dpo@otb.net.
